notes: Canonical named locations of Coffin Canyon.
Some locations are fixed; others allow controlled randomization.

locations.name: Fort Plunder
locations.description: Liberty Corps stronghold at the northern mouth of Coffin Canyon. Rail-controlled, procedural, and lethal by design.
rumors: A sealed rail tunnel beneath the fort leads to something the Corps refuses to map.
Officers stationed here are rotated early because of recurring nightmares.
Uncle Liberty has been sighted here exactly once.

locations.name: Diablo
locations.description: A vast, lawless sprawl at the canyon‚Äôs southern end. Smoke-choked streets, rotbuck deals, pit brothels, and monsters sold on stage.
rumors: The city is built atop a buried Dust King temple that still feeds it power.
Monsters refuse to enter Diablo unless driven or wounded.
Every Shine Rider gang has betrayed someone here.

locations.name: Camp Coffin
locations.description: Monster Rangers headquarters built atop a forgotten Tejas town. A hard sanctuary where monsters are neighbors, not resources.
locations.atmosphere: Uneasy peace held by tired veterans
rumors: Thyr behaves differently inside the camp walls.
A monster elder advises the Rangers in secret.
Monsterology has tried and failed to destroy Camp Coffin three times.

locations.name: The Laboratorium
locations.description: Monsterology‚Äôs primary research complex. Cages, vats, engines, and things that should not be alive.
rumors: Something intelligent is kept alive in the lowest level.
Mort from this site tastes different.
The complex is built on pre-human ruins.

locations.name: Silverpit
locations.description: An active mining wound carved into the canyon wall. Ownership changes violently and often.
rumors: The deepest shaft opens into something that breathes.
A monster nests inside the ore itself.
Silver from Silverpit curses hoarders.

locations.name: Fortune
locations.description: A crossroads settlement that survives by staying useful and pretending neutrality.
rumors: The town council sells information to every faction.
A buried rail line runs under the main street.
Nobody in Fortune sleeps well.

locations.name: River City
locations.description: A settlement clinging to the Widowflow. Life is cheap. Water is not.
rumors: The river changes depth overnight.
Something answers if you speak to the water.
Entire crews vanish mid-crossing.

locations.name: Plata
locations.description: High-altitude silver camp balanced on narrow ridges and bad luck.
rumors: A hidden vein of pure Thyr lies above the camp.
Miners hear singing from sealed tunnels.
No one buried here stays buried.

locations.name: Cowtown
locations.description: Ranch land built atop ancient monster grazing grounds. Livestock thrives unnaturally well.
rumors: The cattle are not entirely mundane.
Monsters mark the land but do not attack openly.
Every herd has a favored animal.

locations.name: Ratsville
locations.description: A shantytown built from scrap, desperation, and bad luck. No law holds.
rumors: Ratsville sits atop a collapsed mine full of bones.
The town moves slightly each year.
Something protects it for unknown reasons.
